result.execSummary:
The defendant Susan M. Olsen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).
  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Defendant to obey all rules and conditions established by the Department of Corrections.

Comply with risk and needs assessments and other screening tools identified by the Department of Corrections.

Comply with case plan goals and follow through with programming recommended by the Department of Corrections.

No consumption or possession of alcohol.  No entering taverns, bars or liquor stores.

No consumption or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription in defendant's own name and must take exactly as directed to be taken.

No possession of drug paraphernalia.

Not associate with known drug dealers, known drug users or their residences.

Not to be present where controlled substances are used or illegally sold.

Defendant to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended.

Submit to random and unannounced drug testing.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

dated October 16, 2014
Sentencing hearing on October 29, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant appears in person with Attorney Longacre.  Defendant waives reading.  Court advises of charges and penalties.  Defendant pleads No Contest to Count One and Count Two.  Court finds defendant Guilty of Count One and Count Two.  Pre-Sentence Investigation ordered - Bond continues.
